@@ -62,2 +62,7 @@ - * $type$ array{#if[char]?, a string,} or some other $type$ - * buffer into this buffer;

+ * $type$ array{#if[char]?, a string, a CharSequence,} + * or some other $type$ buffer into this buffer{#if[char]?,}{#if[!char]?;} +#if[char] + * with relative bulk put capability for {@linkplain CharSequence} sources + * provided in the form of the + * {@linkplain #append(CharSequence,int,int) append} methods; +#end[char] @@ -1467,0 +1472,91 @@ + /** + * Absolute bulk put method  (optional operation). + * + *

This method transfers {@code $type$}s from the given + * {@link CharSequence} into this buffer. If there are more {@code $type$}s + * to be copied from the {@code CharSequence} than remain in this buffer, + * that is, if + * end - start >  + * limit() - index, + * then no {@code $type$}s are transferred and a + * {@link BufferOverflowException} is thrown. + * + *

Otherwise, this method copies + * n = end - start {@code $type$}s + * from the given {@code CharSequence} into this buffer, starting at the + * given {@code start} index and at the given {@code index} in this buffer. + * The position of this buffer is unchanged. + * + *

In other words, an invocation of this method of the form + * dst.put(index, csq, start, end) + * has exactly the same effect as the loop + * + * 

{@code
+     *     for (int i = start, j = index; i < end; i++, j++)
+     *         dst.put(j, csq.charAt(i));
+     * }
+ * + * except that it first checks that there is sufficient space in this + * buffer and it is potentially much more efficient. + * + * @apiNote + * Unlike the other four-parameter absolute bulk put methods in this class, + * this method: + *
    + *
  • defines the range of characters to be read from the source in terms + * of the half-open interval [start, end) instead of + * an {@code offset} and a {@code length};
    • + *
  • throws a {@code BufferOverflowException} instead of an + * {@code IndexOutOfBoundsException} for the condition + * index + end - start > limit(). + *
+ * + * @param index + * The index in this buffer at which the first char will be written; + * must be non-negative and less than {@code limit()} + * + * @param csq + * The {@code CharSequence} from which {@code $type$}s + * are to be read + * + * @param start + * The offset within the {@code CharSequence} of the first $type$ + * to be read; must be non-negative and no larger than + * {@code csq.length()} + * + * @param end + * The offset within the {@code CharSequence} of the last $type$ + * to be read, plus one; must be non-negative and no larger than + * {@code csq.length()} + * + * @return This buffer + * + * @throws BufferOverflowException + * If there is insufficient space in this buffer + * + * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException + * If the preconditions on the {@code index}, {@code start}, + * and {@code end} parameters do not hold + * + * @throws ReadOnlyBufferException + * If this buffer is read-only + * + * @see #append(CharSequence, int, int) + * @see #put(int, $type$[], int, int) + * @see #put(int, $Type$Buffer, int, int) + * @since 22 + */ + public $Type$Buffer put(int index, CharSequence csq, int start, int end) { + Objects.checkFromToIndex(start, end, csq.length()); + Objects.checkIndex(index, limit()); + if (end - start > limit() - index) + throw new BufferOverflowException(); + if (isReadOnly()) + throw new ReadOnlyBufferException(); + + for (int i = start; i < end; i++) + this.put(index++, csq.charAt(i)); + + return this; + } +
